column1: Vyronas (Greek: Βύρωνας) is a suburban town and a municipality in the southeastern part of the Athens agglomeration
column2: Greece. The town is named after George Gordon Byron
column4: the famous English poet and writer
column5: who is a national hero of Greece. Formerly part of the city of Athens
column6: Vyronas was created as a community in 1933
column7: and became a municipality in 1934. The municipality has an area of 9.204 km2.Vyronas is an inner suburb of Athens
column8: located about 3 km southeast of Athens city centre. Towards the southeast the municipality extends to the forested Hymettus mountain. The built-up area of Vyronas is continuous with that of Athens and the neighbouring suburbs Kaisariani
column9: Ymittos and Ilioupoli. Motorway 64 runs through the southeastern part of the municipality.

column3: 340 and is 3 km from downtown Athens. It is home to the football club Athinaikos F.C. and their bitter rivals Doxa Vyronas F.C.

column2: where the Vyronas Festival takes place every summer

column1: Sport facilities in Vyronas are the Vyronas National Stadium (football stadium) and the Ergani Indoor Hall (gymnasium). Clubs based in Vyronas is Athinaikos
column2: club with many achievements in several sports and Doxa Vyronas F.C..
